alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Dense fog close to the shores of Lake Superior will continue this evening, spreading further inland later this evening. Fog is expected to lift through Saturday morning, but may persist into the afternoon for some areas near the shore.

###

Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Locally dense fog has developed and is expected to persist into early Saturday morning before dissipating.

###

Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: fog advisory ended
alerts.description:
Visibilities have improved and are no longer expected to meet fog advisory criteria.

affected_areas.area_description: St. Catharines - Grimsby - Northern Niagara Region

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain expected tonight. 

What:
Freezing rain with ice accretion or build-up of 1 to 2 mm possible.

When:
This evening into early Sunday morning. 

Additional information:
The freezing rain may be mixed with ice pellets at times tonight but should change over to ice pellets or snow early Sunday morning.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: fog advisory ended
alerts.description:
Visibilities have improved and are no longer expected to meet fog advisory criteria.


###

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow expected Monday into Monday night.

What:
Heavy snow with total accumulations of 15 to 25 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Monday morning through Monday night.

Additional information:
A Colorado low will affect the area beginning Sunday night. Precipitation will begin as rain before changing to heavy snow Monday morning. There is also a risk of freezing rain during this transition. Uncertainty remains for the amount of snow that is expected. Snowfall warnings are likely as this event approaches.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: special weather statement in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow expected Monday night into Tuesday.

What:
Heavy snow with total accumulations of 15 to 25 cm.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Monday night into Tuesday.

Additional information:
A Colorado low will affect the area beginning Monday. Precipitation will begin as rain before changing to heavy snow Monday night. There is also a risk of freezing rain during this transition. Uncertainty remains for the amount of snow that is expected. Snowfall warnings are likely as this event approaches.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
